availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Joseph H. Thomason (Scott County, KY, farm laborer)

body.p: Scott County, Kentucky, farm laborer. Kentucky native. Son of Stephen Thomason and Elizabeth Thomason. Married to Nancy Perry Thomason in Scott County, Kentucky, on September 23, 1857. Father of Sallie Thomason. Resident of Scott County in 1850. Household owned four enslaved persons in Scott County in 1850. Farm laborer in Scott County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Scott County, District 2, p. 462B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Scott County, District 2, p. 635.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Scott County, District 1, p. 882.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Scott County Marriages, Film 000183225, p. 91.
"Joseph H. Thomason (1836-1897)," Find A Grave, Memorial 130588837, accessed October 12, 2023, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/130588837.
